module.p: Glottonyms are names identifying languages and other language varieties.

Like other kinds of name, glottonyms can be classified into two grammatical types –
glottonymic proper nouns – Laideann Latin, Beurla English
glottonymic name-descriptions – A’ Ghreugais Greek, Gàidhlig na h-Èireann Irish (Gaelic)
Note that certain glottonyms can function both as a proper noun and as a name-description – Beurla / a’ Bheurla, Gàidhlig / a’ Ghàidhlig.
